intro: Conostylis teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. Conostylis teretifolia is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
